TextBody:
Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection



Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

Hi Fabien,

If you change the clients' communication port, you will have to redeploy them on every computer, but it can be done.
The nginx configuration has to be modified from the backend for this to work.

Best regards,

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection



Best regards,

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #438674 -  - Device does not show up in server console    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MswyS:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000MswyS:ref

Hello,

Server is in a secured environment with no access to internet.
Remote access is forbidden.

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you're on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection
[cid:image003.png@01DB9439.9838FD40]

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you're on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection
[cid:image003.png@01DB94CB.523887B0]

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection



Best regards,

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you're on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you're on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection
[cid:image003.png@01DB998D.02A1ACB0]


Best regards,

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection



Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you're on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you're on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you're on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you're on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection



Best regards,

TextBody:
Hi Fabien,

Our DevOps prepared a virtual image for you, can we please have your confirmation that you will no longer continue to use the previous license?

Please find the download link below:

Virtual Appliance: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_images_5941/Endpoint-Protector-5.9.4.1-Virtual-Appliance-ONG260.zip
MD5: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_images_5941/Endpoint-Protector-5.9.4.1-Virtual-Appliance-ONG260.md5

Virtual Image Info:
- EPP Server v5.9.4.1
- 2CPU, 4GB RAM, 320 GB HDD
- .OVF
- additional epp support account: eppsupport [ Password can only provided after addendum is signed and returned and countersigned by our legal department ]
- port separation enabled - listens on *:8443 (EPP client Communication and *:443 (EPP Server web user interface).

Please do let us know if you have any questions or if you run into any issues.


Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection



Best regards,

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you're on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection

Hi Fabien,

Thanks for reaching out!

Are you having trouble with the Windows client?

Could you please check in System Settings -> System Licensing if you have free licenses?

In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you're on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection
[cid:image003.png@01DBAEAD.FAE70160]

I confirmed internally with our DevOps team that they have set 8443 for the UI, which is the other way around as you require.  Our apologies for the inconvenient caused.  Our DevOps will be swapping the two ports around now and I will share with you the link to download shortly.

Kind regards

TextBody:
Hi Fabien,

You can download the below offline patches and apply them in chronological order.

EPP5941 offline patch
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500665941.tar.gz

EPP5942 offline patch
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500675942.tar.gz 
Release Notes: https://community.netwrix.com/t/version-5-9-4-2-released/3466 

Please do let us know if you encounter any issues.

IMPORTANT:
Please perform a snapshot (Backup) in the virtualization platform of the current state of your Endpoint Protector appliance prior to applying any upgrades.  This way you will have a safety measure and a quick way to revert back to the previous state in case anything goes wrong during the process.

Kind regards
